unnormalised: The Indian Armed Forces are structured with a clear hierarchy of ranks, each carrying specific responsibilities. At the very top sits the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), a 4-star General or equivalent, currently Gen. Anil Chauhan, responsible for tri-service command and coordination. Below the CDS, each service has its own Chief: the Chief of the Army Staff (COAS), typically a Gen. currently Gen. Manoj Pande; the Chief of the Naval Staff (CNS), usually an Admiral; and the Chief of the Air Staff (CAS), generally an Air Chief Marshal.
normalised: The Indian Armed Forces are structured with a clear hierarchy of ranks, each carrying specific responsibilities. At the very top sits the Chief of Defence Staff (C-D-S), a four-star General or equivalent, currently Gen. Anil Chauhan, responsible for tri-service command and coordination. Below the C-D-S, each service has its own Chief: the Chief of the Army Staff (C-O-A-S), typically a Gen. currently Gen. Manoj Pande; the Chief of the Naval Staff (C-N-S), usually an Admiral; and the Chief of the Air Staff (C-A-S), generally an Air Chief Marshal.

unnormalised: Within the Army, ranks progress from commissioned officers like Lieutenants, Captains, Majors, Lt. Cols., Cols., Brigadiers, Maj. Gens., Lt. Gens., to the General. The Navy mirrors this structure with equivalent ranks: Sub Lieutenants, Lieutenants, Lieutenant Commanders, Commanders, Captains, Rear Admirals, Vice Admirals, and Admiral. The Air Force follows a similar pattern with Flying Officers, Flight Lieutenants, Squadron Leaders, Wing Commanders, Group Captains, Air Commodores, Air Vice Marshals, Air Marshals, and Air Chief Marshal.

unnormalised: Non-commissioned officers (NCOs) also form a crucial part of the military's backbone. In the Army, these include ranks like Havildar, Naik, Sepoy. Equivalent ranks exist in the Navy and Air Force, demonstrating the comprehensive structure and specialized roles within each branch of the Indian Armed Forces. Understanding these titles is essential for comprehending the chain of command and the division of responsibilities within the defense establishment.
